product_overview: TrialPulse Nexus 10X is an AI-powered Clinical Trial Intelligence Platform that unifies disparate clinical data sources into a single intelligence layer to accelerate clinical trial timelines and ensure data quality across multiple study roles.
core_goals: Integrate and harmonize clinical trial data from multiple sources into a unified platform.
Provide advanced analytics including Data Quality Index and risk prediction to improve data integrity and operational readiness.
Leverage AI agents to proactively diagnose, forecast, and resolve clinical trial issues.
Enable digital twin simulations for timeline projections and resource optimization.
Facilitate collaboration through Investigation Rooms with audit trail compliance.
Automate clinical reporting across a variety of required report types.
key_features: Data Integration from 9 clinical data sources including EDC Metrics and SAE Dashboards.
Unified Patient Record (UPR) featuring over 260 patient-specific features for comprehensive risk assessment.
Data Quality Index (DQI) calculation based on an 8-component weighted scoring system.
Two-tier classification of patient cleanliness: Clinical Tier and Operational Tier.
DB Lock Readiness tracking to monitor study readiness milestones.
AI Agent System with six specialized agents (Supervisor, Diagnostic, Forecaster, Resolver, Executor, Communicator) operating using ReAct + Tool-Use orchestration.
Digital Twin Engine supporting Monte Carlo simulations and what-if scenario analysis for dynamic timeline projections and CRA resource planning.
Collaboration features via Investigation Rooms supporting issue resolution with full audit trails ensuring 21 CFR Part 11 compliance.
Clinical Reports interface enabling generation and download of 12 distinct report types.
user_flow_summary: Users authenticate securely via Auth Service supporting login, token refresh, and session management.
Study Leads access the Study Lead Dashboard to engage with digital twin simulations and AI-powered insights.
Data Managers review Executive Overview dashboards with portfolio metrics and regional performance visualizations.
Site teams operate within Site Portal for managing Data Quality Index metrics and tracking operational issues.
Users access Unified Patient Record to drill into detailed patient data and risk analytics.
Reports module allows generation, preview, and download of required clinical trial reports.
Collaboration occurs in Investigation Rooms where users engage AI agents and maintain audit logs for compliance.
validation_criteria: Complete and accurate ingestion of all nine specified clinical data sources.
Validated calculation and display of Data Quality Index with correct weighted components.
Robust and accurate patient classification for both clinical and operational tiers.
Demonstrated AI agent performance in diagnosing and resolving trial issues in simulated scenarios.
Verification of Monte Carlo simulation outputs matching projected trial timelines and “what-if” analyses.
Successful generation and correct formatting of all 12 clinical report types.
Compliance with 21 CFR Part 11 verified through audit trail completeness and integrity.
Authentication services reliably maintain session state, including token refresh and logout workflows.
